[{'title': 'Product Details', 'content': [{'title': "About Mero 250 mg Injection 1's", 'content': '$17', 'key': 'AboutProduct'}, {'title': "Uses of Mero 250 mg Injection 1's", 'content': 'Treatment of Severe Bacterial Infections.', 'key': 'Uses'}, {'title': 'Medicinal Benefits', 'content': "

Mero 250 mg Injection 1's is a broad-spectrum antibiotic containing Meropene known to fight against a wide variety of bacterial infections. It is used to treat infections of various body parts like complicated skin and soft tissue infections, blood, lungs (pneumonia including ventilator-associated pneumonia), severe urinary tract infections. It also effectively treats infection in the brain, known as meningitis (infection of the membranes surrounding the brain and spinal cord). It works by killing the bacteria (bactericidal). It prevents the formation of a bacterial protective cell wall, which is required for bacteria to survive. And effectively treat bacterial infection.

", 'key': 'MedicinalBenefits'}, {'title': 'Directions for Use', 'content': "Mero 250 mg Injection 1's will be administered by a healthcare professional; do not self-administer.", 'key': 'HowToTake'}, {'title': 'Storage', 'content': 'Store in a cool and dry place away from sunlight', 'key': 'StoragePlace'}, {'title': "Side Effects of Mero 250 mg Injection 1's", 'content': '
  • Pain
  • Nausea
  • Vomiting
  • Diarrhea
  • Headache
  • Constipation
  • Abdominal (stomach) pain.
  • Insomnia (difficulty falling asleep or staying asleep)
  • Redness, pain, or swelling at the injection site
  • Sores in the mouth or throat
', 'key': 'SideEffects'}]}, {'title': 'In-depth Information', 'content': [{'title': 'Drug Warnings', 'content': "

Do not take Mero 250 mg Injection 1's if you are allergic or have had a severe reaction to meropenem or any other ingredients of Mero 250 mg Injection 1's. Inform your doctor if you have or have ever had kidney disease, seizures (fits), epilepsy or if you participate in regular physical activity. Patients with epilepsy should tell their doctor before taking Mero 250 mg Injection 1's. If you have watery and bloody stools, please visit your doctor immediately, as this could be a sign of a new infection.

", 'key': 'WarningsAndPrecautions'}, {'title': 'Drug Interactions', 'content': "

Drug-Drug Interaction: Mero 250 mg Injection 1's is known to interact with anti-epilepsy medicines (valproic acid, divalproex sodium), and anti-gout medicine (probenecid). 

Drug-Food Interaction: Mero 250 mg Injection 1's should not be taken along with alcohol as it might further affect mental alertness and cause excessive drowsiness.

Drug-Disease Interaction: Mero 250 mg Injection 1's is known to interact in people having a brain or brain tumour, epilepsy, kidney disease or if you are on dialysis.

", 'key': 'DrugInteractions'}, {'title': 'Drug-Drug Interactions Checker List', 'content': 'VALPROIC ACIDDIVALPROEX SODIUMPROBENECID', 'key': 'DrugInteractionsCheckerAPP'}, {'title': 'Habit Forming', 'content': 'No', 'key': 'HabitForming'}, {'title': 'Diet & Lifestyle Advise', 'content': '$18', 'key': 'DietAndLifestyle'}, {'title': 'Special Advise', 'content': "
  • Do not take valproic acid with Mero 250 mg Injection 1's as it is contra-indicate.
  • Regularly monitor your kidney function and blood count while taking Mero 250 mg Injection 1's.
", 'key': 'SpecialAdvise'}]}, {'title': 'Patients Concern', 'content': [{'title': 'Disease/Condition Glossary', 'content': '$19', 'key': 'DiseaseConditionGlossary'}]}]

However, fits are more likely to occur in patients with a history of seizures or a brain lesion (wound, ulcer, abscess, or tumor) or patients having bacterial meningitis or compromised kidney function.Q.For how long will I need to take Merobit?The length of the treatment will be decided by your doctor, depending on your general health, the type of infection you have and how well you respond to Merobit.Q.What if Merobit does not suit me?It is common to have minor side effects such as nausea, vomiting, diarrhea and headache but generally these settle down. If the side effects bother you, tell your doctor immediately. The doctor will give you an alternative medicine. Serious side effects are very rare. In case you develop serious side effects, seek immediate medical advice.Q.Does it matter if I miss or stop Merobit?It is important that you do not stop the treatment without consulting your doctor. Stopping the treatment may bring back the infection or you may develop resistance to Merobit. The same applies if you are forgetful in taking the suggested doses. It is recommended that you do not miss doses. If you do, take the missed dose as soon as you can and take the next dose as planned so that you stick to the same overall daily dose.Medicine disease interaction:Mero 500mg Injection is generally considered safe to use during pregnancy. Animal studies have shown low or no adverse effects to the developing baby; however, there are limited human studies.

output.Description_AI: INTRODUCTIONMERO 500MG INJECTION contains Meropenem which belongs to the group of medicines known as Antibiotics. It is used to treat various bacterial infections such as pneumonia (including community acquired pneumonia and nosocomial pneumonia), urinary tract infections, intra-abdominal infections, gynaecological infections such as endometritis and pelvic inflammatory disease, skin and skin structure infections, meningitis and septicaemia. It is also indicated for empiric treatment, for presumed infections in adult patients with febrile neutropenia, used as monotherapy or in combination with anti-viral or anti-fungal agents. MERO 500MG INJECTION is also used in the management of neutropenic patients with fever that is suspected to be due to a bacterial infection and bacterial infection of the blood. During the treatment, your doctor may do blood tests from time to time. MERO 500MG INJECTION should be used with caution in patients with liver problems, kidney problems, and diarrhea. MERO 500MG INJECTION is generally not recommended in patients with gastrointestinal problems and hypersensitivity reactions. Consult your doctor before receiving if you are pregnant or breastfeeding women. MERO 500MG INJECTION should be used with caution in children over 3 months old and in geriatric patients. The common side effects of MERO 500MG INJECTION are abdominal pain, nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, headache, skin rash, itchy skin, pain, and inflammation. Consult your doctor if the above symptom does not improve. USES OF MERO 500MG INJECTIONUsed to treat bacterial infections such as: pneumonia (including community acquired pneumonia and nosocomial pneumonia) urinary tract infections intra-abdominal infections gynaecological infections such as endometritis and pelvic inflammatory disease skin and skin structure infections meningitis septicaemia HOW MERO 500MG INJECTION WORKSMERO 500MG INJECTION is a broad-spectrum carbapenem antibiotic which is active against gram-positive and gram-negative bacteria. It exerts its action by penetrating bacterial cells readily and interfering with the synthesis of vital cell wall components, which leads to cell death. DIRECTIONS FOR USEMERO 500MG INJECTION will be administered intravenously only by a doctor or a nurse. Your doctor will administer the correct dose and duration for you depending on your age, body weight, and severity of the infection. SIDE EFFECTS OF MERO 500MG INJECTIONCOMMON abdominal pain nausea vomiting diarrhea headache skin rash, itchy skin pain and inflammation increased platelets in the blood change in blood tests UNCOMMON tingling feeling (pins and needles) infections of the mouth or the vagina are caused by a fungus (thrush) diarrhea with bowel inflammation sore veins frequent infections, high temperature, and sore throat sudden beginning of a severe rash or blistering or peeling skin (may be associated with a high fever and joint pains) RARE fits (seizures) acute disorientation and confusion Contact your doctor immediately if you experience any of the following side effects after receiving MERO 500MG INJECTION: severe allergic reaction (severe rash, itching, or hives on the skin, swelling of the face, lips, tongue, or other parts of the body, shortness of breath, wheezing, or trouble breathing) serious skin reactions (serious hypersensitivity reactions involving fever, skin rash, changes in the blood tests, severe red scaly rash, skin bumps that contain pus, blisters or peeling of the skin, severe skin rashes appearing as reddish circular patches often with central blisters on the trunk, skin peeling, ulcers of mouth, throat, nose, genitals, and eyes) being breathlessness when you do not expect it and red or brown urine (may be a sign of damage to red blood cells) HOW TO MANAGE SIDE EFFECTSNausea or Vomiting: Take this medicine with, or just after meals. Stick to simple meals. Avoid eating oil-rich or spicy foods. Diarrhoea: Drink more fluids like water or fruit juice to keep yourself hydrated. Do not consume any medicine on your own for diarrhea without consulting your doctor. Stomach pain: Try to rest and relax. Eat and drink slowly or try to have lesser and more frequent meals. Keep a heating pad on your stomach. If the symptom does not improve, contact your doctor. Headache: Rest and relax. Drink more fluids like water and apply a pain-relieving balm on the head if needed. Do not consume alcohol. If the symptom does not improve, contact your doctor. WARNING & PRECAUTIONSPREGNANCYMERO 500MG INJECTION should not be used in pregnancy unless the benefit justifies the potential risk to the foetus. Consult your doctor before receiving. BREASTFEEDINGMERO 500MG INJECTION should not be used in breast-feeding women unless the benefit justifies the potential risk to the baby. Consult your doctor before receiving. DRIVING AND USING MACHINESThere is no data available, but it is anticipated that MERO 500MG INJECTION will not affect the ability to drive and use machines. KIDNEYMERO 500MG INJECTION should be taken with caution in patients with kidney problems. If needed dose will be adjusted accordingly. Consult your doctor before receiving. LIVERMERO 500MG INJECTION should be used with caution in patients with liver problems. Consult your doctor before receiving. ALLERGYDo not use MERO 500MG INJECTION if you are allergic to Meropenem, antibiotics such as penicillins, cephalosporins, or carbapenems or to any ingredients of this medicine. HEART DISEASENA OTHERSMERO 500MG INJECTION is not recommended if you have or had: a history of gastro-intestinal problems like colitis hypersensitivity reactions Before receiving MERO 500MG INJECTION, inform your doctor if you have or had: severe diarrhoea Use in pediatrics: MERO 500MG INJECTION is not recommended to use in children below 3 months. Your doctor will administer the right dose depends on your child's age, body weight and severity of the infection for children above 3 months. Consult your doctor for advice before receiving MERO 500MG INJECTION. Use in geriatrics: MERO 500MG INJECTION should be used with caution in elderly patients. Consult your physician for advice before receiving MERO 500MG INJECTION. INTERACTIONSA. Drug-Drug interactions: Before receiving MERO 500MG INJECTION inform your doctor if you are taking any of the following medicine: medicine used for the treatment of gout (Ex. probenecid) medicines used to treat epilepsy (Ex. valproic acid, sodium valproate, valpromide) medicines used to prevent or treat blood clots (Ex. warfarin) Overdosage: MERO 500MG INJECTION will be administered to you only by a doctor or a nurse in a hospital, and so it is unlikely to receive an overdose. However, consult your physician or nurse if you experience any unusual symptoms. SYNOPSIS Drug : Meropenem Pharmacological Category : Carbapenem Antibiotics Therapeutic Indication : Bacterial infections Dosage Forms : Injection MORE INFORMATION Keep out of reach of children Store below 25Â°C FAQs ABOUT MERO 500MG INJECTIONCan MERO 500MG INJECTION be used in children? MERO 500MG INJECTION is generally not recommended to use in children below 3 months and it should be used with caution in children 3 months and older. Your doctor will administer the right dose depends on your child's age, body weight and severity of the infection. Can I stop receiving MERO 500MG INJECTION if I feel my condition improved? No. You should not stop receiving the treatment even when you feel your condition improved. Stopping the treatment may bring back the infection or you may develop resistance to MERO 500MG INJECTION. What are the common side effects of MERO 500MG INJECTION? The common side effects of MERO 500MG INJECTION are abdominal pain, nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, headache, skin rash, itchy skin, pain, and inflammation. Consult your doctor if the above symptom does not improve. Is it safe to receive MERO 500MG INJECTION during pregnancy and lactating? MERO 500MG INJECTION should not be used during pregnancy and lactating unless the benefit justifies the potential risk to the foetus. Consult your doctor before receiving. Can I use MERO 500MG INJECTION in patients having epilepsy? Before using MERO 500MG INJECTION, consult your doctor regarding epilepsy as the medicines used for the treatment of epilepsy may interfere with the effects of MERO 500MG INJECTION. REFERENCES1. output.Description_AI: Product introductionMero 500mg Injection is an antibiotic that is used to treat severe infections of the skin, lungs, stomach, urinary tract, blood, and brain (eg. meningitis). It works by killing the bacteria that cause these problems. However, it will not treat a viral infection.Mero 500mg Injection is commonly used to treat critically ill patients admitted to the hospital. This medicine is given by drip/infusion or by direct injection into a vein, under the supervision of a doctor or a nurse. The dose will depend on what type of infection you have, where it is in the body, and how serious it is. You should keep on taking the injection for as long as you have been prescribed, even if your symptoms quickly improve. If you stop taking it too early the infection may return or worsen.Some people may develop side effects like headache, nausea, constipation, diarrhea, anemia, vomiting, and rash. These side effects are usually temporary and go away as your body adjusts to the medicine. Consult your doctor if these side effects bother you or do not go away. Before starting treatment with this medicine, you should tell your doctor if you have epilepsy (seizures), liver or kidney problems or if you are allergic to any antibiotic. While using it, you may be advised blood tests to monitor your blood cell count and kidney function. This medicine is generally regarded as safe to use in pregnancy and breastfeeding if prescribed by the doctor.

Drug-Drug Interaction: Mero 500 mg Injection is known to interact with anti-epilepsy medicines (valproic acid, divalproex sodium), and anti-gout medicine (probenecid). 

Drug-Food Interaction: Mero 500 mg Injection should not be taken along with alcohol as it might further affect mental alertness and cause excessive drowsiness.

Drug-Disease Interaction: Mero 500 mg Injection is known to interact in people having a brain or brain tumour, epilepsy, kidney disease or if you are on dialysis.

output.Cluster_Description: Mero 500mg Injection Uses:Merobit 500mg Injection is used in severe bacterial infections. It is used in infections of various body parts like skin and soft tissues, urinary tract, blood, brain and lungs (pneumonia).Mero 500mg Injection composition:Meropenem 500mgInteractions / Warnings:Consuming alcohol with Mero 500mg Injection does not cause any harmful side effects.Pregnancy interaction:Mero 500mg Injection is generally considered safe to use during pregnancy. Animal studies have shown low or no adverse effects to the developing baby; however, there are limited human studies.Expert advice:Meropenem is an antibiotic that's usually only given in the hospital for serious infections.Inform your doctor if you are allergic to penicillin or if you are taking any seizure medication before starting treatment with this medication.Diarrhea may occur as a side effect. Inform your doctor if you develop severe stomach pain or if you find blood in your stools.Your doctor may monitor your kidney function while you are having treatment with this medication.Mero 500mg Injection Side Effects:Meropenem : Injection site reactions (pain, swelling, redness), Nausea, Vomiting, Headache, RashHow to use Mero 500mg Injection :No interaction found/establishedHow Mero 500mg Injection works:Merobit 500mg Injection is an antibiotic. It kills bacteria by preventing them from forming the bacterial protective covering (cell wall) which is needed for them to survive.Faq:Q.Is Merobit a strong antibiotic? Which infections does it treat?Merobit is a broad-spectrum antibiotic. This means that it is used to treat a variety of bacterial infections. It is used to treat infection affecting the lungs (pneumonia) and complicated infections of the urinary tract, abdomen, and skin and soft tissue infections. It also treats bacterial infection of the membranes that surround the brain and spinal cord (meningitis) and infections that occur during or after delivery.Q.Is Merobit effective against bacteria only? Can it be used for any type of bacterial infection?Yes, Merobit is effective against bacteria only but not all bacteria. It is not effective against virus or fungi. Merobit is effective against some bacteria which include Staphylococcus aureus, Streptococcus pneumoniae, S. pyogenes, S. viridans group, etc. Merobit should only be used to treat or prevent infections against which it is effective.Q.My cousin was receiving Merobit for severe skin infection when she had a fit and Merobit was stopped. Was the fit due to Merobit?Seizures or fits have been reported with the use of Merobit. However, fits are more likely to occur in patients with a history of seizures or a brain lesion (wound, ulcer, abscess, or tumor) or patients having bacterial meningitis or compromised kidney function.Q.For how long will I need to take Merobit?The length of the treatment will be decided by your doctor, depending on your general health, the type of infection you have and how well you respond to Merobit.Q.What if Merobit does not suit me?It is common to have minor side effects such as nausea, vomiting, diarrhea and headache but generally these settle down. If the side effects bother you, tell your doctor immediately. The doctor will give you an alternative medicine. Serious side effects are very rare. In case you develop serious side effects, seek immediate medical advice.Q.Does it matter if I miss or stop Merobit?It is important that you do not stop the treatment without consulting your doctor. Stopping the treatment may bring back the infection or you may develop resistance to Merobit. The same applies if you are forgetful in taking the suggested doses. It is recommended that you do not miss doses. If you do, take the missed dose as soon as you can and take the next dose as planned so that you stick to the same overall daily dose.Medicine disease interaction:Mero 500mg Injection is generally considered safe to use during pregnancy. Animal studies have shown low or no adverse effects to the developing baby; however, there are limited human studies.

output.Description_AI: Product introductionMero O 300mg Tablet ER is an antibiotic medicine that is primarily used in the treatment of infections of the lungs and urinary tract. Additionally, it may also be used to treat skin and gynecological infections. It is usually used for infections that did not resolve with other antibiotics.Mero O 300mg Tablet ER is the only medicine of its class that can be taken orally (by mouth). It may be taken with or without food. The dose and duration of treatment depend upon the severity of the infection and how you respond to the medicine. Take it at the same time each day and finish the complete course, even if you feel better. If you stop taking this medicine too early then the infection may return or worsen.The most common side effects of this medicine include rash, nausea, abdominal pain, and diarrhea. These are usually mild and resolve on their own. However, if they bother you or persist for a longer duration of time, please consult your doctor.Before using it, you should tell your doctor if you are allergic to any antibiotics or if you have any problems related to your kidneys or liver. Let your doctor know about all other medicines you may be taking, as they may affect, or be affected by this medicine. Pregnant and breastfeeding mothers should consult their doctor before using it to prevent any harmful effects on the baby.

INTRODUCTIONMERO O ER 300 TABLET contains Faropenem which belongs to the group of medicines called Antibiotics. It is used in the treatment of respiratory tract infections, ear nose and throat infections, urinary tract infections, skin and skin structure infections and gynaecological infections. MERO O ER 300 TABLET is not recommended for use in patients with rare hereditary problems like galactose intolerance, Lapp lactase deficiency and glucose galactose malabsorption. Contact your doctor before taking. MERO O ER 300 TABLET should be used with caution in patients with liver or kidney diseases, history of hypersensitivity or anaphylactic reactions to penicillin, cephem or carbapenems, family history of atopy, poor oral intake or poor general health or vitamin K deficiency, diarrhea and loose bowel movement. Contact your doctor before taking. MERO O ER 300 TABLET is generally not recommended for use in pregnant women unless considered clearly necessary. Contact your doctor before taking. MERO O ER 300 TABLET is not recommended for use in breastfeeding women as it may pass through the breast milk. Contact your doctor before taking it. MERO O ER 300 TABLET is not recommended for use in children. Contact your doctor before taking. MERO O ER 300 TABLET should be used with caution in elderly patients aged 65 years above. Contact your doctor before taking. The most common side effects of taking MERO O ER 300 TABLET are vomiting, stomach pain, diarrhoea and lack of appetite, gastritis, constipation, dizziness, drowsiness, edema, muscle pain and lethargy. Contact your physician if any of the symptoms worsen. USES OF MERO O ER 300 TABLETIt is used to treat: upper and lower respiratory tract infection urinary tract infection skin and skin structure infection gynaecological infection HOW MERO O ER 300 TABLET WORKSMERO O ER 300 TABLET works against the bacteria by preventing them from forming the bacterial protective covering (cell wall) which is needed for them to survive. DIRECTIONS FOR USETake MERO O ER 300 TABLET as advised by your physician. Swallow the medicine with a glass of water. Do not crush or chew the medicine. Your physician will decide the correct dose and duration for you depending upon your age, body weight and disease condition. SIDE EFFECTS OF MERO O ER 300 TABLETCOMMON vomiting stomach pain diarrhoea gastritis constipation lack of appetite dizziness, drowsiness edema muscle pain lethargy HOW TO MANAGE SIDE EFFECTSVomiting: Take the medicine, with or just after a meal. Stick to simple meals. Avoid eating oily or spicy food. Diarrhoea: Drink lots of fluids, such as water or fruit juices to keep you hydrated. Do not take any medicine on your own for treating diarrhea. Contact your doctor if the symptom did not improve. Stomach pain: Rest and relax. Try to have smaller meals but take frequently. Keep a heat pad on your stomach. Do not self-treat and contact your doctor if the symptom did not improve. Constipation: Eat plenty of fibre rich foods such as fresh fruits, vegetables and cereals. Drink plenty of water and exercise more regularly. Dizziness: Try to rest and relax. Get enough sleep. Avoid driving or operate any machines while you are feeling dizzy. Do not consume alcohol, as it can aggravate your dizziness. Contact your doctor if the symptom did not improve. WARNING & PRECAUTIONSPREGNANCYMERO O ER 300 TABLET is generally not recommended for use in pregnant women unless considered clearly necessary. Contact your doctor before taking MERO O ER 300 TABLET. BREASTFEEDINGMERO O ER 300 TABLET is not recommended for use in breastfeeding women as it may pass through the breast milk. Contact your doctor before taking MERO O ER 300 TABLET. KIDNEYMERO O ER 300 TABLET should be used with caution in patients with kidney disease. Contact your doctor before taking MERO O ER 300 TABLET. LIVERMERO O ER 300 TABLET should be used with caution in patients with liver disease. Contact your doctor before taking MERO O ER 300 TABLET. ALLERGYDo not take MERO O ER 300 TABLET if you are allergic to Faropenem or other beta lactam antibiotics or to lactose or to other ingredients of this medicine. OTHERSMERO O ER 300 TABLET is not recommended for use if you have: rare hereditary problems like galactose intolerance, Lapp lactase deficiency and glucose galactose malabsorption Before taking MERO O ER 300 TABLET, inform your doctor if you have: family history of atopy poor oral intake or poor general health vitamin K deficiency diarrhea and loose bowel movement Use in pediatrics: MERO O ER 300 TABLET is not recommended for use in children. Contact your doctor before taking MERO O ER 300 TABLET. Use in geriatrics: MERO O ER 300 TABLET should be used with caution in elderly patients aged 65 years or above. Contact your doctor before taking MERO O ER 300 TABLET. INTERACTIONSA. Drug - Drug interactions: Before taking MERO O ER 300 TABLET, inform your physician if you are taking any of the following medicine: imipenem and cilastatin sodium combination (medicines used to treat bacterial infections) furosemide (medicines used for hypertension, edema) sodium valproate (medicines used to treat seizures) Overdosage: If you or anyone else accidentally takes too much of MERO O ER 300 TABLET, consult your doctor immediately or visit the nearby hospital. SYNOPSIS Drug : Faropenem Pharmacological Category : Antibiotics Therapeutic Indication : Bacterial infections Dosage Forms : Tablet MORE INFORMATION Keep MERO O ER 300 TABLET out of reach of children Store MERO O ER 300 TABLET at room temperature FAQs ABOUT MERO O ER 300 TABLETFor what conditions MERO O ER 300 TABLET is used? MERO O ER 300 TABLET is used in the treatment of respiratory tract infections, ear nose and throat infections, urinary tract infections, skin and skin structure infections and gynaecological infections. Contact your doctor before taking MERO O ER 300 TABLET. How MERO O ER 300 TABLET work? MERO O ER 300 TABLET works against the bacteria by preventing them from forming the bacterial protective covering (cell wall) which is needed for them to survive. What are the possible side effects of taking MERO O ER 300 TABLET? The most common side effects of taking MERO O ER 300 TABLET are vomiting, stomach pain, diarrhoea and lack of appetite, gastritis, constipation, dizziness, drowsiness, edema, muscle pain and lethargy. Contact your physician if any of the symptoms worsen. Can I use MERO O ER 300 TABLET in children? No. MERO O ER 300 TABLET is not recommended for use in children. Contact your doctor before taking MERO O ER 300 TABLET. Does MERO O ER 300 TABLET cause drowsiness? Yes. MERO O ER 300 TABLET may cause drowsiness. Try to rest and relax. Get enough sleep. Avoid driving or operate any machines while you are feeling dizzy. Do not consume alcohol, as it can aggravate your dizziness. Contact your doctor if the symptom did not improve. REFERENCES1. USES OF MERO O ER 300 TABLETIt is used to treat: upper and lower respiratory tract infection urinary tract infection skin and skin structure infection gynaecological infection HOW MERO O ER 300 TABLET WORKSMERO O ER 300 TABLET works against the bacteria by preventing them from forming the bacterial protective covering (cell wall) which is needed for them to survive. SIDE EFFECTS OF MERO O ER 300 TABLETCOMMON vomiting stomach pain diarrhoea gastritis constipation lack of appetite dizziness, drowsiness edema muscle pain lethargy HOW TO MANAGE SIDE EFFECTSVomiting: Take the medicine, with or just after a meal. output.Description_AI: Product introductionMero-O ER 300 Tablet is an antibiotic medicine that is primarily used in the treatment of infections of the lungs and urinary tract. Additionally, it may also be used to treat skin and gynecological infections. It is usually used for infections that did not resolve with other antibiotics.Mero-O ER 300 Tablet is the only medicine of its class that can be taken orally (by mouth). It may be taken with or without food. The dose and duration of treatment depend upon the severity of the infection and how you respond to the medicine. Take it at the same time each day and finish the complete course, even if you feel better. If you stop taking this medicine too early then the infection may return or worsen.The most common side effects of this medicine include rash, nausea, abdominal pain, and diarrhea. These are usually mild and resolve on their own. However, if they bother you or persist for a longer duration of time, please consult your doctor.Before using it, you should tell your doctor if you are allergic to any antibiotics or if you have any problems related to your kidneys or liver. Let your doctor know about all other medicines you may be taking, as they may affect, or be affected by this medicine. Pregnant and breastfeeding mothers should consult their doctor before using it to prevent any harmful effects on the baby.

Product introductionMero-O 200 Tablet is an antibiotic medicine that is primarily used in the treatment of infections of the lungs and urinary tract. Additionally, it may also be used to treat skin and gynecological infections. It is usually used for infections that did not resolve with other antibiotics.Mero-O 200 Tablet is the only medicine of its class that can be taken orally (by mouth). It may be taken with or without food. The dose and duration of treatment depend upon the severity of the infection and how you respond to the medicine. Take it at the same time each day and finish the complete course, even if you feel better. If you stop taking this medicine too early then the infection may return or worsen.The most common side effects of this medicine include rash, nausea, abdominal pain, and diarrhea. These are usually mild and resolve on their own. However, if they bother you or persist for a longer duration of time, please consult your doctor.Before using it, you should tell your doctor if you are allergic to any antibiotics or if you have any problems related to your kidneys or liver. Let your doctor know about all other medicines you may be taking, as they may affect, or be affected by this medicine. Pregnant and breastfeeding mothers should consult their doctor before using it to prevent any harmful effects on the baby.

INTRODUCTIONMERO O 200 TABLET contains Faropenem which belongs to the group of medicines called Antibiotics. It is used in the treatment of respiratory tract infections, ear nose and throat infections, urinary tract infections, skin and skin structure infections and gynaecological infections. MERO O 200 TABLET is not recommended for use in patients with rare hereditary problems like galactose intolerance, Lapp lactase deficiency and glucose galactose malabsorption. Contact your doctor before taking. MERO O 200 TABLET should be used with caution in patients with liver or kidney diseases, history of hypersensitivity or anaphylactic reactions to penicillin, cephem or carbapenems, family history of atopy, poor oral intake or poor general health or vitamin K deficiency, diarrhea and loose bowel movement. Contact your doctor before taking. MERO O 200 TABLET is generally not recommended for use in pregnant women unless considered clearly necessary. Contact your doctor before taking. MERO O 200 TABLET is not recommended for use in breastfeeding women as it may pass through the breast milk. Contact your doctor before taking it. MERO O 200 TABLET is not recommended for use in children. Contact your doctor before taking. MERO O 200 TABLET should be used with caution in elderly patients aged 65 years above. Contact your doctor before taking. The most common side effects of taking MERO O 200 TABLET are vomiting, stomach pain, diarrhoea, and lack of appetite, gastritis, constipation, dizziness, drowsiness, edema, muscle pain and lethargy. Contact your physician if any of the symptoms worsen. USES OF MERO O 200 TABLETIt is used to treat: upper and lower respiratory tract infection urinary tract infection skin and skin structure infection gynaecological infection HOW MERO O 200 TABLET WORKSMERO O 200 TABLET works against the bacteria by preventing them from forming the bacterial protective covering (cell wall) which is needed for them to survive. DIRECTIONS FOR USETake MERO O 200 TABLET as advised by your physician. Swallow the medicine with a glass of water. Do not crush or chew the medicine. Your physician will decide the correct dose and duration for you depending upon your age, body weight and disease condition. SIDE EFFECTS OF MERO O 200 TABLETCOMMON vomiting stomach pain diarrhoea gastritis constipation lack of appetite dizziness, drowsiness edema muscle pain lethargy HOW TO MANAGE SIDE EFFECTSConstipationEat plenty of fibre rich foods such as fresh fruits, vegetables, and cereals. Drink plenty of water and exercise more regularly. DiarrheaDrink lots of fluids, such as water or fruit juices to keep you hydrated. Do not take any medicine on your own for treating diarrhea. Contact your doctor if the symptom did not improve. Dizziness Or DrowsinessTry to rest and relax. Get enough sleep. Avoid driving or operate any machines while you are feeling dizzy. Do not consume alcohol, as it can aggravate your dizziness. Contact your doctor if the symptom did not improve. Nausea And VomitingTake the medicine, with or just after a meal. Stick to simple meals. Avoid eating oily or spicy food. Stomach PainRest and relax. Try to have smaller meals but take frequently. Keep a heat pad on your stomach. Do not self-treat and contact your doctor if the symptom did not improve. WARNING & PRECAUTIONSPREGNANCYMonitoring requiredMERO O 200 TABLET is generally not recommended for use in pregnant women unless considered clearly necessary. Contact your doctor before taking MERO O 200 TABLET. BREASTFEEDINGContraindicatedMERO O 200 TABLET is not recommended for use in breastfeeding women as it may pass through the breast milk. Contact your doctor before taking MERO O 200 TABLET. KIDNEYUse with CautionMERO O 200 TABLET should be used with caution in patients with kidney disease. Contact your doctor before taking MERO O 200 TABLET. LIVERUse with CautionMERO O 200 TABLET should be used with caution in patients with liver disease. Contact your doctor before taking MERO O 200 TABLET. ALLERGYContraindicatedDo not take MERO O 200 TABLET if you are allergic to Faropenem, or other beta lactam antibiotics or to lactose, or to other ingredients of this medicine. USE IN PEDIATRICSContraindicatedMERO O 200 TABLET is not recommended for use in children. Contact your doctor before taking MERO O 200 TABLET. USE IN GERIATRICSUse with CautionMERO O 200 TABLET should be used with caution in elderly patients aged 65 years or above. Contact your doctor before taking MERO O 200 TABLET. OTHERSMERO O 200 TABLET is not recommended for use if you have: rare hereditary problems like galactose intolerance, Lapp lactase deficiency and glucose galactose malabsorption Before taking MERO O 200 TABLET, inform your doctor if you have: family history of atopy poor oral intake or poor general health vitamin K deficiency diarrhea and loose bowel movement INTERACTIONSA. Drug-Drug interactions: Before taking MERO O 200 TABLET, inform your physician if you are taking any of the following medicine: imipenem and cilastatin sodium combination (medicines used to treat bacterial infections) furosemide (medicines used for hypertension, edema) sodium valproate (medicines used to treat seizures) Overdosage: If you or anyone else accidentally takes too much of MERO O 200 TABLET, consult your doctor immediately or visit the nearby hospital. SYNOPSIS Drug : Faropenem Pharmacological Category : Antibiotics Therapeutic Indication : Bacterial infections Dosage Forms : Tablet MORE INFORMATION Keep MERO O 200 TABLET out of reach of children Store MERO O 200 TABLET at room temperature FAQs ABOUT MERO O 200 TABLETQ: For what conditions MERO O 200 TABLET is used? A: MERO O 200 TABLET is used in the treatment of respiratory tract infections, ear nose and throat infections, urinary tract infections, skin and skin structure infections and gynaecological infections. Contact your doctor before taking MERO O 200 TABLET. Q: How MERO O 200 TABLET work? A: MERO O 200 TABLET works against the bacteria by preventing them from forming the bacterial protective covering (cell wall) which is needed for them to survive. Q: What are the possible side effects of taking MERO O 200 TABLET? A: The most common side effects of taking MERO O 200 TABLET are vomiting, stomach pain, diarrhoea, and lack of appetite, gastritis, constipation, dizziness, drowsiness, edema, muscle pain and lethargy. Contact your physician if any of the symptoms worsen. Q: Can I use MERO O 200 TABLET in children? A: No. MERO O 200 TABLET is not recommended for use in children. Contact your doctor before taking MERO O 200 TABLET. Q: Does MERO O 200 TABLET cause drowsiness? A: Yes. MERO O 200 TABLET may cause drowsiness. Try to rest and relax. Get enough sleep. Avoid driving or operate any machines while you are feeling dizzy. Do not consume alcohol, as it can aggravate your dizziness. Contact your doctor if the symptom did not improve. REFERENCES1. M Lindsay Grayson. Faropenem. Kucers The use of Antibiotics. Seventh edition. 2018. Page-765. 2. Kristen N Schurek , Ryan Wiebe, James A Karlowsky, Ethan Rubinstein, Daryl J Hoban, George G Zhanel. output.Description_AI: Product introductionMero-O 200 Tablet is an antibiotic medicine that is primarily used in the treatment of infections of the lungs and urinary tract. Additionally, it may also be used to treat skin and gynecological infections. It is usually used for infections that did not resolve with other antibiotics.Mero-O 200 Tablet is the only medicine of its class that can be taken orally (by mouth). It may be taken with or without food. The dose and duration of treatment depend upon the severity of the infection and how you respond to the medicine. Take it at the same time each day and finish the complete course, even if you feel better. If you stop taking this medicine too early then the infection may return or worsen.The most common side effects of this medicine include rash, nausea, abdominal pain, and diarrhea. These are usually mild and resolve on their own. However, if they bother you or persist for a longer duration of time, please consult your doctor.Before using it, you should tell your doctor if you are allergic to any antibiotics or if you have any problems related to your kidneys or liver. Let your doctor know about all other medicines you may be taking, as they may affect, or be affected by this medicine. Pregnant and breastfeeding mothers should consult their doctor before using it to prevent any harmful effects on the baby.

USE IN PEDIATRICSContraindicatedMERO O 200 TABLET is not recommended for use in children. Contact your doctor before taking MERO O 200 TABLET. USE IN GERIATRICSUse with CautionMERO O 200 TABLET should be used with caution in elderly patients aged 65 years or above. Contact your doctor before taking MERO O 200 TABLET. OTHERSMERO O 200 TABLET is not recommended for use if you have: rare hereditary problems like galactose intolerance, Lapp lactase deficiency and glucose galactose malabsorption Before taking MERO O 200 TABLET, inform your doctor if you have: family history of atopy poor oral intake or poor general health vitamin K deficiency diarrhea and loose bowel movement INTERACTIONSA. Drug-Drug interactions: Before taking MERO O 200 TABLET, inform your physician if you are taking any of the following medicine: imipenem and cilastatin sodium combination (medicines used to treat bacterial infections) furosemide (medicines used for hypertension, edema) sodium valproate (medicines used to treat seizures) Overdosage: If you or anyone else accidentally takes too much of MERO O 200 TABLET, consult your doctor immediately or visit the nearby hospital. SYNOPSIS Drug : Faropenem Pharmacological Category : Antibiotics Therapeutic Indication : Bacterial infections Dosage Forms : Tablet MORE INFORMATION Keep MERO O 200 TABLET out of reach of children Store MERO O 200 TABLET at room temperature FAQs ABOUT MERO O 200 TABLETQ: For what conditions MERO O 200 TABLET is used? A: MERO O 200 TABLET is used in the treatment of respiratory tract infections, ear nose and throat infections, urinary tract infections, skin and skin structure infections and gynaecological infections. Contact your doctor before taking MERO O 200 TABLET. Q: How MERO O 200 TABLET work? A: MERO O 200 TABLET works against the bacteria by preventing them from forming the bacterial protective covering (cell wall) which is needed for them to survive. Q: What are the possible side effects of taking MERO O 200 TABLET? A: The most common side effects of taking MERO O 200 TABLET are vomiting, stomach pain, diarrhoea, and lack of appetite, gastritis, constipation, dizziness, drowsiness, edema, muscle pain and lethargy. Contact your physician if any of the symptoms worsen. Q: Can I use MERO O 200 TABLET in children? A: No. MERO O 200 TABLET is not recommended for use in children. Contact your doctor before taking MERO O 200 TABLET. Q: Does MERO O 200 TABLET cause drowsiness? A: Yes. MERO O 200 TABLET may cause drowsiness. Try to rest and relax. Get enough sleep. Avoid driving or operate any machines while you are feeling dizzy. Do not consume alcohol, as it can aggravate your dizziness. Contact your doctor if the symptom did not improve. REFERENCES1. output.Description_AI: Mero 1g Injection Uses:Merobit 500mg Injection is used in severe bacterial infections. It is used in infections of various body parts like skin and soft tissues, urinary tract, blood, brain and lungs (pneumonia).Mero 1g Injection composition:Meropenem 1000mgInteractions / Warnings:Consuming alcohol with Mero 1g Injection does not cause any harmful side effects.Pregnancy interaction:Mero 1g Injection is generally considered safe to use during pregnancy. Animal studies have shown low or no adverse effects to the developing baby; however, there are limited human studies.Expert advice:Meropenem is an antibiotic that's usually only given in the hospital for serious infections.Inform your doctor if you are allergic to penicillin or if you are taking any seizure medication before starting treatment with this medication.Diarrhea may occur as a side effect. Inform your doctor if you develop severe stomach pain or if you find blood in your stools.Your doctor may monitor your kidney function while you are having treatment with this medication.Mero 1g Injection Side Effects:Meropenem : Injection site reactions (pain, swelling, redness), Nausea, Vomiting, Headache, RashHow to use Mero 1g Injection :No interaction found/establishedHow Mero 1g Injection works:Merobit 500mg Injection is an antibiotic. It kills bacteria by preventing them from forming the bacterial protective covering (cell wall) which is needed for them to survive.Faq:Q.Is Merobit a strong antibiotic? Which infections does it treat?Merobit is a broad-spectrum antibiotic. This means that it is used to treat a variety of bacterial infections. It is used to treat infection affecting the lungs (pneumonia) and complicated infections of the urinary tract, abdomen, and skin and soft tissue infections. It also treats bacterial infection of the membranes that surround the brain and spinal cord (meningitis) and infections that occur during or after delivery.Q.Is Merobit effective against bacteria only? Can it be used for any type of bacterial infection?Yes, Merobit is effective against bacteria only but not all bacteria. It is not effective against virus or fungi. Merobit is effective against some bacteria which include Staphylococcus aureus, Streptococcus pneumoniae, S. pyogenes, S. viridans group, etc. Merobit should only be used to treat or prevent infections against which it is effective.Q.My cousin was receiving Merobit for severe skin infection when she had a fit and Merobit was stopped. Was the fit due to Merobit?Seizures or fits have been reported with the use of Merobit. However, fits are more likely to occur in patients with a history of seizures or a brain lesion (wound, ulcer, abscess, or tumor) or patients having bacterial meningitis or compromised kidney function.Q.For how long will I need to take Merobit?The length of the treatment will be decided by your doctor, depending on your general health, the type of infection you have and how well you respond to Merobit.Q.What if Merobit does not suit me?It is common to have minor side effects such as nausea, vomiting, diarrhea and headache but generally these settle down. If the side effects bother you, tell your doctor immediately. The doctor will give you an alternative medicine. Serious side effects are very rare. In case you develop serious side effects, seek immediate medical advice.Q.Does it matter if I miss or stop Merobit?It is important that you do not stop the treatment without consulting your doctor. Stopping the treatment may bring back the infection or you may develop resistance to Merobit. The same applies if you are forgetful in taking the suggested doses. It is recommended that you do not miss doses. If you do, take the missed dose as soon as you can and take the next dose as planned so that you stick to the same overall daily dose.Medicine disease interaction:It is not known whether Mero 1g Injection alters the ability to drive. Do not drive if you experience any symptoms that affect your ability to concentrate and react.

output.Description_AI: INTRODUCTIONMERO 1GM INJECTION contains Meropenem which belongs to the group of medicines known as Antibiotics. It is used to treat various bacterial infections such as pneumonia (including community acquired pneumonia and nosocomial pneumonia), urinary tract infections, intra-abdominal infections, gynaecological infections such as endometritis and pelvic inflammatory disease, skin and skin structure infections, meningitis and septicaemia. It is also indicated for empiric treatment, for presumed infections in adult patients with febrile neutropenia, used as monotherapy or in combination with anti-viral or anti-fungal agents. MERO 1GM INJECTION is also used in the management of neutropenic patients with fever that is suspected to be due to a bacterial infection and bacterial infection of the blood. During the treatment, your doctor may do blood tests from time to time. MERO 1GM INJECTION should be used with caution in patients with liver problems, kidney problems, and diarrhea. MERO 1GM INJECTION is generally not recommended in patients with gastrointestinal problems and hypersensitivity reactions. Consult your doctor before receiving if you are pregnant or breastfeeding women. MERO 1GM INJECTION should be used with caution in children over 3 months old and in geriatric patients. The common side effects of MERO 1GM INJECTION are abdominal pain, nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, headache, skin rash, itchy skin, pain, and inflammation. Consult your doctor if the above symptom does not improve. USES OF MERO 1GM INJECTIONUsed to treat bacterial infections such as: pneumonia (including community acquired pneumonia and nosocomial pneumonia) urinary tract infections intra-abdominal infections gynaecological infections such as endometritis and pelvic inflammatory disease skin and skin structure infections meningitis septicaemia HOW MERO 1GM INJECTION WORKSMERO 1GM INJECTION is a broad-spectrum carbapenem antibiotic which is active against gram-positive and gram-negative bacteria. It exerts its action by penetrating bacterial cells readily and interfering with the synthesis of vital cell wall components, which leads to cell death. DIRECTIONS FOR USEMERO 1GM INJECTION will be administered intravenously only by a doctor or a nurse. Your doctor will administer the correct dose and duration for you depending on your age, body weight, and severity of the infection. SIDE EFFECTS OF MERO 1GM INJECTIONCOMMON abdominal pain nausea vomiting diarrhea headache skin rash, itchy skin pain and inflammation increased platelets in the blood change in blood tests UNCOMMON tingling feeling (pins and needles) infections of the mouth or the vagina are caused by a fungus (thrush) diarrhea with bowel inflammation sore veins frequent infections, high temperature, and sore throat sudden beginning of a severe rash or blistering or peeling skin (may be associated with a high fever and joint pains) RARE fits (seizures) acute disorientation and confusion Contact your doctor immediately if you experience any of the following side effects after receiving MERO 1GM INJECTION: severe allergic reaction (severe rash, itching, or hives on the skin, swelling of the face, lips, tongue, or other parts of the body, shortness of breath, wheezing, or trouble breathing) serious skin reactions (serious hypersensitivity reactions involving fever, skin rash, changes in the blood tests, severe red scaly rash, skin bumps that contain pus, blisters or peeling of the skin, severe skin rashes appearing as reddish circular patches often with central blisters on the trunk, skin peeling, ulcers of mouth, throat, nose, genitals, and eyes) being breathlessness when you do not expect it and red or brown urine (may be a sign of damage to red blood cells) HOW TO MANAGE SIDE EFFECTSNausea or Vomiting: Take this medicine with, or just after meals. Stick to simple meals. Avoid eating oil-rich or spicy foods. Diarrhoea: Drink more fluids like water or fruit juice to keep yourself hydrated. Do not consume any medicine on your own for diarrhea without consulting your doctor. Stomach pain: Try to rest and relax. Eat and drink slowly or try to have lesser and more frequent meals. Keep a heating pad on your stomach. If the symptom does not improve, contact your doctor. Headache: Rest and relax. Drink more fluids like water and apply a pain-relieving balm on the head if needed. Do not consume alcohol. If the symptom does not improve, contact your doctor. WARNING & PRECAUTIONSPREGNANCYMERO 1GM INJECTION should not be used in pregnancy unless the benefit justifies the potential risk to the foetus. Consult your doctor before receiving. BREASTFEEDINGMERO 1GM INJECTION should not be used in breast-feeding women unless the benefit justifies the potential risk to the baby. Consult your doctor before receiving. DRIVING AND USING MACHINESThere is no data available, but it is anticipated that MERO 1GM INJECTION will not affect the ability to drive and use machines. KIDNEYMERO 1GM INJECTION should be taken with caution in patients with kidney problems. If needed dose will be adjusted accordingly. Consult your doctor before receiving. LIVERMERO 1GM INJECTION should be used with caution in patients with liver problems. Consult your doctor before receiving. ALLERGYDo not use MERO 1GM INJECTION if you are allergic to Meropenem, antibiotics such as penicillins, cephalosporins, or carbapenems or to any ingredients of this medicine. OTHERSMERO 1GM INJECTION is not recommended if you have or had: a history of gastro-intestinal problems like colitis hypersensitivity reactions Before receiving MERO 1GM INJECTION, inform your doctor if you have or had: severe diarrhoea Use in pediatrics: MERO 1GM INJECTION is not recommended to use in children below 3 months. Your doctor will administer the right dose depends on your child's age, body weight and severity of the infection for children above 3 months. Consult your doctor for advice before receiving MERO 1GM INJECTION. Use in geriatrics: MERO 1GM INJECTION should be used with caution in elderly patients. Consult your physician for advice before receiving MERO 1GM INJECTION. INTERACTIONSA. Drug-Drug interactions: Before receiving MERO 1GM INJECTION inform your doctor if you are taking any of the following medicine: medicine used for the treatment of gout (Ex. probenecid) medicines used to treat epilepsy (Ex. valproic acid, sodium valproate, valpromide) medicines used to prevent or treat blood clots (Ex. warfarin) Overdosage: MERO 1GM INJECTION will be administered to you only by a doctor or a nurse in a hospital, and so it is unlikely to receive an overdose. However, consult your physician or nurse if you experience any unusual symptoms. SYNOPSIS Drug : Meropenem Pharmacological Category : Carbapenem Antibiotics Therapeutic Indication : Bacterial infections Dosage Forms : Injection MORE INFORMATION Keep out of reach of children Store below 25Â°C FAQs ABOUT MERO 1GM INJECTIONCan MERO 1GM INJECTION be used in children? MERO 1GM INJECTION is generally not recommended to use in children below 3 months and it should be used with caution in children 3 months and older. Your doctor will administer the right dose depends on your child's age, body weight and severity of the infection. Can I stop receiving MERO 1GM INJECTION if I feel my condition improved? No. You should not stop receiving the treatment even when you feel your condition improved. Stopping the treatment may bring back the infection or you may develop resistance to MERO 1GM INJECTION. What are the common side effects of MERO 1GM INJECTION? The common side effects of MERO 1GM INJECTION are abdominal pain, nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, headache, skin rash, itchy skin, pain, and inflammation. Consult your doctor if the above symptom does not improve. Is it safe to receive MERO 1GM INJECTION during pregnancy and lactating? MERO 1GM INJECTION should not be used during pregnancy and lactating unless the benefit justifies the potential risk to the foetus. Consult your doctor before receiving. Can I use MERO 1GM INJECTION in patients having epilepsy? Before using MERO 1GM INJECTION, consult your doctor regarding epilepsy as the medicines used for the treatment of epilepsy may interfere with the effects of MERO 1GM INJECTION. REFERENCES1. Mero 1gm Injection 1's is a broad-spectrum antibiotic containing Meropene known to fight against a wide variety of bacterial infections. It is used to treat infections of various body parts like complicated skin and soft tissue infections, blood, lungs (pneumonia including ventilator-associated pneumonia), severe urinary tract infections. It also effectively treats infection in the brain, known as meningitis (infection of the membranes surrounding the brain and spinal cord). It works by killing the bacteria (bactericidal). It prevents the formation of a bacterial protective cell wall, which is required for bacteria to survive. And effectively treat bacterial infection.

", 'key': 'MedicinalBenefits'}, {'title': 'Directions for Use', 'content': "Mero 1gm Injection 1's will be administered by a healthcare professional; do not self-administer.", 'key': 'HowToTake'}, {'title': 'Storage', 'content': 'Store in a cool and dry place away from sunlight', 'key': 'StoragePlace'}, {'title': "Side Effects of Mero 1gm Injection 1's", 'content': '
  • Pain
  • Nausea
  • Vomiting
  • Diarrhea
  • Headache
  • Constipation
  • Abdominal (stomach) pain.
  • Insomnia (difficulty falling asleep or staying asleep)
  • Redness, pain, or swelling at the injection site
  • Sores in the mouth or throat
', 'key': 'SideEffects'}]}, {'title': 'In-depth Information', 'content': [{'title': 'Drug Warnings', 'content': "

Do not take Mero 1gm Injection 1's if you are allergic or have had a severe reaction to meropenem or any other ingredients of Mero 1gm Injection 1's. Inform your doctor if you have or have ever had kidney disease, seizures (fits), epilepsy or if you participate in regular physical activity. Patients with epilepsy should tell their doctor before taking Mero 1gm Injection 1's. If you have watery and bloody stools, please visit your doctor immediately, as this could be a sign of a new infection.

", 'key': 'WarningsAndPrecautions'}, {'title': 'Drug Interactions', 'content': "

Drug-Drug Interaction: Mero 1gm Injection 1's is known to interact with anti-epilepsy medicines (valproic acid, divalproex sodium), and anti-gout medicine (probenecid). 

Drug-Food Interaction: Mero 1gm Injection 1's should not be taken along with alcohol as it might further affect mental alertness and cause excessive drowsiness.

Drug-Disease Interaction: Mero 1gm Injection 1's is known to interact in people having a brain or brain tumour, epilepsy, kidney disease or if you are on dialysis.

", 'key': 'DrugInteractions'}, {'title': 'Drug-Drug Interactions Checker List', 'content': 'VALPROIC ACIDDIVALPROEX SODIUMPROBENECID', 'key': 'DrugInteractionsCheckerAPP'}, {'title': 'Habit Forming', 'content': 'No', 'key': 'HabitForming'}, {'title': 'Diet & Lifestyle Advise', 'content': '$18', 'key': 'DietAndLifestyle'}, {'title': 'Special Advise', 'content': "
  • Do not take valproic acid with Mero 1gm Injection 1's as it is contra-indicate.
  • Regularly monitor your kidney function and blood count while taking Mero 1gm Injection 1's.
", 'key': 'SpecialAdvise'}]}, {'title': 'Patients Concern', 'content': [{'title': 'Disease/Condition Glossary', 'content': '$19', 'key': 'DiseaseConditionGlossary'}]}]

Meroap 125mg Injection is a broad-spectrum antibiotic containing Meropene known to fight against a wide variety of bacterial infections. It is used to treat infections of various body parts like complicated skin and soft tissue infections, blood, lungs (pneumonia including ventilator-associated pneumonia), severe urinary tract infections. It also effectively treats infection in the brain, known as meningitis (infection of the membranes surrounding the brain and spinal cord). It works by killing the bacteria (bactericidal). It prevents the formation of a bacterial protective cell wall, which is required for bacteria to survive. And effectively treat bacterial infection.

", 'key': 'MedicinalBenefits'}, {'title': 'Directions for Use', 'content': 'Meroap 125mg Injection will be administered by a healthcare professional; do not self-administer.', 'key': 'HowToTake'}, {'title': 'Storage', 'content': 'Store in a cool and dry place away from sunlight', 'key': 'StoragePlace'}, {'title': 'Side Effects of Meroap 125mg Injection', 'content': '
  • Pain
  • Nausea
  • Vomiting
  • Diarrhea
  • Headache
  • Constipation
  • Abdominal (stomach) pain.
  • Insomnia (difficulty falling asleep or staying asleep)
  • Redness, pain, or swelling at the injection site
  • Sores in the mouth or throat
', 'key': 'SideEffects'}]}, {'title': 'In-depth Information', 'content': [{'title': 'Drug Warnings', 'content': "

Do not take Meroap 125mg Injection if you are allergic or have had a severe reaction to meropenem or any other ingredients of Meroap 125mg Injection. Inform your doctor if you have or have ever had kidney disease, seizures (fits), epilepsy or if you participate in regular physical activity. Patients with epilepsy should tell their doctor before taking Meroap 125mg Injection. If you have watery and bloody stools, please visit your doctor immediately, as this could be a sign of a new infection.

", 'key': 'WarningsAndPrecautions'}, {'title': 'Drug Interactions', 'content': '

Drug-Drug Interaction: Meroap 125mg Injection is known to interact with anti-epilepsy medicines (valproic acid, divalproex sodium), and anti-gout medicine (probenecid). 

Drug-Food Interaction: Meroap 125mg Injection should not be taken along with alcohol as it might further affect mental alertness and cause excessive drowsiness.

Drug-Disease Interaction: Meroap 125mg Injection is known to interact in people having a brain or brain tumour, epilepsy, kidney disease or if you are on dialysis.

', 'key': 'DrugInteractions'}, {'title': 'Drug-Drug Interactions Checker List', 'content': 'VALPROIC ACIDDIVALPROEX SODIUMPROBENECID', 'key': 'DrugInteractionsCheckerAPP'}, {'title': 'Habit Forming', 'content': 'No', 'key': 'HabitForming'}, {'title': 'Diet & Lifestyle Advise', 'content': '$18', 'key': 'DietAndLifestyle'}, {'title': 'Special Advise', 'content': "
  • Do not take valproic acid with Meroap 125mg Injection as it is contra-indicate.
  • Regularly monitor your kidney function and blood count while taking Meroap 125mg Injection.
", 'key': 'SpecialAdvise'}]}, {'title': 'Patients Concern', 'content': [{'title': 'Disease/Condition Glossary', 'content': '$19', 'key': 'DiseaseConditionGlossary'}]}]
output.Cluster_Description: Product introductionMeroap S 1000mg/500mg Injection is a combination medicine that is prescribed to treat various types of bacterial infections. It fights against the microorganisms to prevent their growth.Meroap S 1000mg/500mg Injection should only be administered under the supervision of a healthcare professional. Do not miss any scheduled appointments for taking this medicine. The course of the medicine should be completed even if you feel better.The common side effects of this medicine are nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, rashes, etc. You may also experience injection site redness, swelling, and pain that goes away with time. If any of the side effects get aggravated, you must consult your doctor immediately. If you experience any allergic reaction (rashes, itching, swelling, shortness of breath, etc.), you must seek immediate medical help.Before taking this medicine, you should tell your doctor if you are taking any medicines for any health condition. Pregnant or breastfeeding women should also consult with their doctor before taking it. Avoid drinking alcohol as it can cause excessive drowsiness with this medicine. It usually does not impair your ability to drive, but you should not drive if it makes you feel sleepy or dizzy.

output.Description_AI: Meroart 1gm Injection Uses:Merobit 500mg Injection is used in severe bacterial infections. It is used in infections of various body parts like skin and soft tissues, urinary tract, blood, brain and lungs (pneumonia).Meroart 1gm Injection composition:Meropenem 1gmInteractions / Warnings:Consuming alcohol with Meroart 1gm Injection does not cause any harmful side effects.Pregnancy interaction:Meroart 1gm Injection is generally considered safe to use during pregnancy. Animal studies have shown low or no adverse effects to the developing baby; however, there are limited human studies.Expert advice:Meropenem is an antibiotic that's usually only given in the hospital for serious infections.Inform your doctor if you are allergic to penicillin or if you are taking any seizure medication before starting treatment with this medication.Diarrhea may occur as a side effect. Inform your doctor if you develop severe stomach pain or if you find blood in your stools.Your doctor may monitor your kidney function while you are having treatment with this medication.Meroart 1gm Injection Side Effects:Meropenem : Injection site reactions (pain, swelling, redness), Nausea, Vomiting, Headache, RashHow to use Meroart 1gm Injection :No interaction found/establishedHow Meroart 1gm Injection works:Merobit 500mg Injection is an antibiotic. It kills bacteria by preventing them from forming the bacterial protective covering (cell wall) which is needed for them to survive.Faq:Q.Is Merobit a strong antibiotic? Which infections does it treat?Merobit is a broad-spectrum antibiotic. This means that it is used to treat a variety of bacterial infections. It is used to treat infection affecting the lungs (pneumonia) and complicated infections of the urinary tract, abdomen, and skin and soft tissue infections. It also treats bacterial infection of the membranes that surround the brain and spinal cord (meningitis) and infections that occur during or after delivery.Q.Is Merobit effective against bacteria only? Can it be used for any type of bacterial infection?Yes, Merobit is effective against bacteria only but not all bacteria. It is not effective against virus or fungi. Merobit is effective against some bacteria which include Staphylococcus aureus, Streptococcus pneumoniae, S. pyogenes, S. viridans group, etc. Merobit should only be used to treat or prevent infections against which it is effective.Q.My cousin was receiving Merobit for severe skin infection when she had a fit and Merobit was stopped. Was the fit due to Merobit?Seizures or fits have been reported with the use of Merobit. However, fits are more likely to occur in patients with a history of seizures or a brain lesion (wound, ulcer, abscess, or tumor) or patients having bacterial meningitis or compromised kidney function.Q.For how long will I need to take Merobit?The length of the treatment will be decided by your doctor, depending on your general health, the type of infection you have and how well you respond to Merobit.Q.What if Merobit does not suit me?It is common to have minor side effects such as nausea, vomiting, diarrhea and headache but generally these settle down. If the side effects bother you, tell your doctor immediately. The doctor will give you an alternative medicine. Serious side effects are very rare. In case you develop serious side effects, seek immediate medical advice.Q.Does it matter if I miss or stop Merobit?It is important that you do not stop the treatment without consulting your doctor. Stopping the treatment may bring back the infection or you may develop resistance to Merobit. The same applies if you are forgetful in taking the suggested doses. It is recommended that you do not miss doses. If you do, take the missed dose as soon as you can and take the next dose as planned so that you stick to the same overall daily dose.Medicine disease interaction:Meroart 1gm Injection should be used with caution in patients with kidney disease. Dose adjustment of Meroart 1gm Injection may be needed. Please consult your doctor.

output.Description_AI: Meroaxis 1gm injection is an antibiotic medication in the carbapenems category, containing the active ingredient Meropenem. It is used to treat various bacterial infections caused by susceptible organisms. This injection also treats skin, lung, urine, and gynecological infections. Mostly, it can be used during the prevention of surgical site infections.This drug is mainly contraindicated in individuals with known hypersensitivity or allergic reactions to other beta-lactam antibiotics, such as penicillins or cephalosporins. If you have experienced severe diarrhea after taking other antibiotics, it is important to inform your physician. Meroaxis 1gm injection can reduce the serum concentrations of valproic acid, a medication used to treat seizures and certain mental health conditions. It can lead to decreased effectiveness of valproic acid. If you take valproic acid, your healthcare provider may need to adjust the dose or consider alternative treatments.Before starting treatment with Meroaxis 1gm injection, it's necessary to inform your physician about any pre-existing medical conditions you have, such as epilepsy (seizures), kidney or liver problems, or if you are on a salt-controlled diet. During treatment, your doctor may recommend blood tests to monitor your blood cell count and kidney function. If you suspect pregnancy or plan to have a baby, inform your doctor about all the medications you have been taking recently, including herbal and supplements.

output.Description_AI: An injectable medication, Merobact 1 gm injection, is prescribed for various bacterial infections. Administered via injection, it provides a concentrated dose directly into the bloodstream for rapid action. The typical dosage is 1 gram, with frequency and duration determined by the severity of the infection. Side effects may include local injection site reactions, gastrointestinal disturbances, or allergic responses. Caution is advised for patients with known allergies to penicillin or cephalosporins. It is crucial to complete the full course as prescribed to ensure the infection is completely eradicated. Always consult a healthcare professional for proper administration and to address any concerns regarding potential side effects or interactions with other medications.

output.Description_AI: Product introductionMerobact 500mg Injection is an antibiotic that is used to treat severe infections of the skin, lungs, stomach, urinary tract, blood, and brain (eg. meningitis). It works by killing the bacteria that cause these problems. However, it will not treat a viral infection.Merobact 500mg Injection is commonly used to treat critically ill patients admitted to the hospital. This medicine is given by drip/infusion or by direct injection into a vein, under the supervision of a doctor or a nurse. The dose will depend on what type of infection you have, where it is in the body, and how serious it is. You should keep on taking the injection for as long as you have been prescribed, even if your symptoms quickly improve. If you stop taking it too early the infection may return or worsen.Some people may develop side effects like headache, nausea, constipation, diarrhea, anemia, vomiting, and rash. These side effects are usually temporary and go away as your body adjusts to the medicine. Consult your doctor if these side effects bother you or do not go away. Before starting treatment with this medicine, you should tell your doctor if you have epilepsy (seizures), liver or kidney problems or if you are allergic to any antibiotic. While using it, you may be advised blood tests to monitor your blood cell count and kidney function. This medicine is generally regarded as safe to use in pregnancy and breastfeeding if prescribed by the doctor.

output.Description_AI: Product introductionMerobactum T 1000mg/125mg Injection is a combination of two antibiotic medicines. It is used to treat severe bacterial infections of the skin, lungs, stomach, urinary tract, blood, brain, and others. It works by killing and stopping the growth of the bacteria that cause these problems.Merobactum T 1000mg/125mg Injection is given by a doctor or a nurse. You should not self-administer this medicine at home. The dose and duration will depend on what type of infection you have, where it is in the body, and how serious it is. Get the injection as long as your doctor has prescribed it to get the most benefit from it. If you stop getting the injection, the infection may return or worsen.Some people may develop side effects like nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, rash, or local redness and swelling at the site of injection. These side effects are usually temporary and go away during treatment as your body adjusts to the medicine. Consult your doctor if these side effects bother you or do not go away.Before starting treatment with this medicine, you should tell your doctor if you have epilepsy, liver, or kidney problems, or if you are allergic to any antibiotic. While using it, you may be advised blood tests to monitor your blood cells and kidney function. Consult your doctor if you are pregnant or breastfeeding to make sure it is safe for you and the developing baby.
